flashcards.kikuyu: Time System - African vs Western Hours
flashcards.english: Africans start the day at 7am = thaa îmwe cia rũciũ-inĩ (hour 1, not 7), ending at 6pm = thaa ikũmi na igĩrĩ/thinacara (hour 12, not 6). Night starts at 7pm = thaa îmwe cia hũaĩ-inĩ (hour 1 of night, not 7)
flashcards.notes: African time system counts from sunrise (6am/7am) and sunset (6pm/7pm) as hour 1, not from midnight. Day hours: thaa + number + cia rũciũ-inĩ. Night hours: thaa + number + cia hũaĩ-inĩ. Cultural note: thinacara = noon/6pm (hour 12)

flashcards.english: Future negative pattern: Ndi-/Tũtĩ-/Ndũ-/Mũtĩ-/Nda-/Matĩ- + verb. Examples: Ndigũkwĩra (I will not tell you), Tũtĩkwaria (we will not speak), Ndũkwaria (you will not speak), Mũtĩkwaria (you all will not speak), Moiga matĩkwaria (they said they will not speak). Present negative: Ndiaragia (I don't speak), Ndaragia (he/she doesn't speak), Tũtĩaragia (we don't speak)
flashcards.notes: Comprehensive negation system. Future uses -tĩ- infix (1st plural, 2nd plural, 3rd plural). Singular forms: Ndi-/Ndũ-/Nda-. Present tense negation slightly different. Pattern: negative prefix + (tĩ-optional) + verb
